title: The Collected+ReCovered Sin City (DH|Dgtl-1280|Empire) Â®1.1
description:
************************************************************************************
* Changes against revision 1.0 (  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9053810" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9053810</a>   ):     *
*                                                                                  *
* - Re-wrapped each volume to add material from the recently released artbook      *
*   (e.g.  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/11307941" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/11307941</a>   ) and for minor tweaking.    *
* - Added "Sin City Collector Cards" booklet, again extracted from said artbook.   *
************************************************************************************

Overview:     <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sin_City" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sin_City</a>

Contains:      Sin City            (1991)      (Digital-1280)               (Empire)
               A Dame to Kill for  (1993)      (Digital-1280)               (Empire)
               The Big Fat Kill    (1994)      (Digital-1280) (Son of Ultron-Empire)
               That Yellow Bastard (1996)      (Digital-1280) (Son of Ultron-Empire)
               Family Values       (1997)      (Digital-1280) (Son of Ultron-Empire)
               Hell and Back       (1999)      (Digital-1280) (Son of Ultron-Empire)
             + Various Shorts      (1993-1997) (Digital-1280) (Son of Ultron-Empire)

Compiled principally from the contents of the 7-volume release from back in late 2012, the recent Minutemen versions (see link above) being lower-res still. The "ReCovered" in the title refers to two slight (and somewhat subjective) improvements in presentation: Firstly, while the new cover artwork for the digital edition is gorgeous, it's not very well suited to its purpose; these volumes are bookended with the full-colour covers used in the print editions (or equivalent) instead. Secondly, about a dozen double-page spreads, each split into two regular pages in the original releases, were re-joined, thereby greatly enhancing their visual effectiveness, IMO
